title: Quit control: Close browser tab and stop Streamlit server (Barebones + Full)
body:
Implement a consistent quit UX that: (1) uses a two-step confirmation, (2) attempts to close the current browser tab via a small JS snippet (where the browser allows), and (3) stops the Streamlit server process cross-platform (Windows/PowerShell friendly) using a safe delayed os._exit(0).

Acceptance criteria:
- Barebones: Replace current quit with two buttons: 'Close this tab' and 'Stop server'; document that some browsers may block window.close for non-script-opened tabs.
- Full build: Add the same quit controls in the sidebar.
- Works on Windows (Chrome/Edge/Firefox) without requiring Ctrl+C in the terminal.
- Displays clear instructions if the tab cannot be closed automatically.
- Tested locally; docs updated in README.

title: Show guardrail failure reasons in UI (Barebones + Full)
body:
Indicate in the UI why an email fails guardrail checks. Show guardrail status and notes per email in the Results/Overview tabs, with an expandable list of notes (e.g., 'Missing subject', 'Empty email body'). Highlight REJECTED and WARN statuses.

Acceptance criteria:
- Barebones: Results tab lists guardrail status and an expander per item for notes.
- Full: Corpus Overview shows guardrail status; add a section listing WARN/REJECTED with notes.
- Ensure notes come from guardrail_agent outputs.

title: Fix corrupted requirements.txt and add missing runtime dependencies (Full Build)
body:
requirements.txt appears to contain non-text/binary artifacts and is missing app runtime deps. Recreate as clean text and include minimal pinned deps: langchain==1.0.5, langchain-core==1.0.4, langchain-community==0.4.1, langchain-openai==1.0.2, openai==2.8.0, chromadb==1.3.4, beautifulsoup4==4.12.3, python-dotenv, streamlit, pandas.

Acceptance: fresh venv pip install -r requirements.txt completes, streamlit app launches.

title: Update ChatOpenAI initialization to use 'model' param and temperature fallback
body:
Update full_agentic_build/utils/llm_utils.py to use ChatOpenAI(model=...) (newer API), with safe handling when temperature is unsupported. Keep LLMAdapter.

Acceptance: create_llm() works for gpt-4o-mini and other models; logs fallback only when needed.

title: README corrections and operational docs (Full Build)
body: Correct example LLM model (avoid 'gpt-5'); document required env vars; add notes about quitting the app and browser limitations; include instructions for Windows PowerShell and Docker.

title: Add Clear Corpus and Reprocess controls to UI
body: Provide buttons to clear corpus, re-run processing selectively, and download results CSV in both Barebones and Full builds.

title: Add retries/backoff and JSON parsing resilience for LLM agents
body: Wrap temporal/subscription agent calls with retries (exponential backoff), timeouts, and robust JSON parsing with schema validation and fallbacks.

title: Stop committing vectorstore artifacts; add .gitignore and migration
body: Add data/vectorstore to .gitignore; provide a cleanup script; keep a small synthetic dataset under data/sample_emails only.

title: Add unit tests for agents and services
body: Tests for parsing_agent, guardrail_agent, classification_agent (prompt IO mocked), temporal/subscription JSON parsing, and semantic search indexing.

title: Expose model/embedding configuration in UI and support alt providers
body: Allow selecting chat and embedding models from the UI (env defaults), and document how to switch to non-OpenAI embeddings if desired.

title: Docker run docs and compose validation
body: Validate docker-compose workflow with mounted data and .env, ensure Vectorstore persists, and document how to set OPENAI_API_KEY and quit the app from inside the container.
